entry.title: California COVID-19 Spending
entry.summary: If I were in politics... Specifically if I was the governor of California*. I would have prioritized hospital preparedness over vaccination encouragement. What I mean by hospital preparedness is insuring that the hospitals had enough of the needed resources to treat individuals with COVID-19…
entry.content:
If I were in politics...

Specifically if I was the governor of California*.

I would have prioritized hospital preparedness over vaccination encouragement.

What I mean by hospital preparedness is insuring that the hospitals had enough of the needed resources to treat individuals with COVID-19 like Hydroxycholoquine and ventilators. Hydroxycholoquine costs (on average) $148.95 (retail) and ventilators cost between $20,000 and $50,000 (For this post we are just going to assume the average cost of $35,000). 

Let's say the money spent on the vaccine lottery and given illegally to illegal immigrants was spent on hospital resources, that would give us a budget of approximately $191,000,000. With this money, we could purchase 1,275,595 doses of Hydroxycholoquine with $1,000,000 devoted to delivery costs or 5,428 ventilators (Once again with a $1,000,000 budget for delivering the units). The money could also be split between the two. 

However, the point is that the money spent illegally on people who are not here legally and on a lottery could have been spent in better ways to help provide better treatment for the people of California and be prepared for any future flare ups of the disease. With any disease, there are flare ups, or hills and valleys. Being prepared for the next hill should be a priority, and a vaccine does not do not. The vaccine has been proven to not protect the vaccinated from contacting the disease post receiving the vaccine, that and it is not FDA approved. The government should not encourage the use of a drug that is not FDA approved.

Sources:

What is a ventilator? How much does one cost? (2020, March 23). Silive. https://www.silive.com/coronavirus/2020/03/what-is-a-ventilator-how-much-does-one-cost.html

Hydroxychloroquine Prices, Coupons & Savings Tips. (n.d.). GoodRx. Retrieved July 16, 2021, from https://www.goodrx.com/hydroxychloroquine

Press, A. (n.d.). California to give 150,000 undocumented immigrants $500 coronavirus aid payments. MarketWatch. Retrieved July 16, 2021, from https://www.marketwatch.com/story/california-to-give-150000-undocumented-immigrants-500-coronavirus-aid-payments-2020-04-15

California giving $116 million to people who get virus shots. (n.d.). Retrieved July 16, 2021, from https://news.yahoo.com/california-offer-116m-coronavirus-vaccine-210408708.html

Are COVID Vaccines FDA Approved? Hereâ€™s the Latest. NBC Chicago. Retrieved July 16, 2021, from https://www.nbcchicago.com/news/coronavirus/are-covid-vaccines-fda-approved-heres-the-latest/2549097/

*THIS IS A HYPOTHETICAL. THIS IS NOT A DECLARATION OF INTENT TO RUN FOR ANY POLITICAL POSITION.

entry.title: Today's Tech

entry.content:
Gettr has been "quietly" released on the Apple and Google Play stores.

I say "quietly" because so many media sites have reported on it. Gettr is a new, unbiased social networking created by Jason Miller, a former adviser to former president Trump. Gettr operates like twitter and has a vibe similar to Minds. Gettr is definitely different from Parler and I believe you should check it out! 

Gettr

Facebook warns users about "extremists."

Facebook has begun warning users when the platform believes they have been exposed to an "extremist" or to "harmful content" and encourages users to "get support."

Read more on Foxnews.

entry.title: Doubt: What's Wrong with It?
entry.summary: But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind. James 1:6 NIV Throughout the Bible, we can see time and time again people sinning. In…
entry.content:
Throughout the Bible, we can see time and time again people sinning. In many of the accounts of sin in the Bible there is a common factor: doubt. In Genesis 3, the serpent plants a seed of doubt and makes Eve question what God said about the tree in the middle of the garden ("Genesis 3"). In the book of Exodus, we can see another example of doubt caused sin. In Exodus 32, the people lose faith and begin to question God and His plan ("Exodus 32").

"What can we do about our doubt?"

The Bible provides an answer to doubt: faith.

Conclusion:

We cannot prevent doubt, but we can prevent it from getting the best of us. When we begin to doubt, we need to have faith in God and pray.

Sources:
  • "James 1:6", Bible.com
  • "Genesis 3", Bible.com
  • "Exodus 32", Bible.com
  • "1 Peter 5:7", Bible.com
  • "Philippians 4:6", Bible.com
